data.title: Limit snippet typing bounds

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 0.10.11
  Commit f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
  Date 2016-03-11T16:19:03.130Z
  Shell 0.35.6
  Renderer 45.0.2454.85
  Node 4.1.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3 Cinnamon 64 bit.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a snippet that has (same) ids
2. use that snippet.
3. go to one of them, type something then delete. continue deleting beyond the starting position.
   OR
4. go to one of them, type something then enter, it will continue to the next line, in all of the location markers.

result: it deletes text in all the locations, since it uses multi cursors but has no bounds. it also goes to next lines if pressing enter.

expected behaviour: limit the bounds. from starting position until end of the line.

data.title: Editor: navigate to next error/warning should keep focus in editor
data.body: My use case was to navigate to warnings to fix missing semicolons and after pressing F8 I always had to click back into the editor to focus it. I think the error/warning box should not receive focus but focus remains in the editor after navigate.

data.title: Update Dockerfile highlighting to support 'ARG'
data.body:
Upstream [changes](https://github.com/docker/docker/commit/8d7459140701006fb8e3a0550872ce55c43bcec0) from the Dockerfile tmLanguage within Docker's repo:
- Added highlighting for [ARG](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#arg) instructions within a Dockerfile 
- Aligned doctype declaration with Apple's spec (see Apple's [info.plst](http://opensource.apple.com/source/IOUSBFamily/IOUSBFamily-208.4.5/pbxbuild.data/IOUSBHIDDriver.build/Info.plist))

data.title: Accessing the extensions menu hangs forever
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  0.10.11
- OS Version: OSX Yosemite 10.10.5 (14F1605) 
  ![screen shot 2016-04-10 at 23 33 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5532905/14416169/0560d91e-ff75-11e5-8729-92bc8e46374e.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press `^ + Shift + P`
2. Hit `install extensions` or `show install extensions`
3. Wait forever

No console errors pop up and no network requests pop up either.
I've deleted every file and folder on this computer with the `VSCode` in the name and still encounter this issue.

data.title: Package dependency not found
Switch header / source file for C/C++
data.body: It would be nice to have a command to switch directly to the corresponding header / source file in C/C++'s .h/.hpp/.c/.cpp files. Sublime Text uses `Alt+O` for that on Windows and Linux.

data.title: File (taskName) not found when running task
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Linux

I am trying to run this task (<kbd>Ctrl+Shift+B</kbd>):

``` json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "mcs",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["-pkg:glade-sharp-2.0","${workspaceRoot}/Source/MainApp.cs"],
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "build"
        }
    ]
}
```

And when I do, I get the following error:

```
error CS2001: Source file `build' could not be found
Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
```

data.title: launch.json is not autoloading after created
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.11
- OS Version:Windows 7 ultimate 64 bit 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. When i first press f5 launch.json is created but debug console is not opening... Again pressing f5 (Please set up the launch configuration file to debug your application visual studio code) massage showed..
2.  When i close vs code and re open it this time last created launch.json is loaded and pressing f5 debug console opened.

data.title: Collapsing large folder in file explorer with keyboard has parent folder selection go off screen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a large folder, for example `node_modules`
2. Scroll down so the parent is not visible
3. Click on a folder in `node_modules` and press <kbd>←</kbd> to collapse folder
4. If there were enough entries below `node_modules`, it will now be off screen. I expect it to be selected at the top of the explorer

data.title: Code Folding Oddity with Indented Subsequent Lines
data.body: - VSCode Version: 0.10.11 - OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan (10.11.4) **Steps to Reproduce:** I honestly am not sure how to reproduce it because I have tried and it does not. So I just took a series of screenshots so that maybe you guys could figure out the pattern. It has not been causing any issues for me at all, except for seeming weird. Hopefully it doesn't affect anyone's code, but I know sometimes a seemingly-small problem can turn out to balloon later on, so I just wanted to help you catch it just in case it does! :) **Problem:** When collapsing blocks of code (in this case line # 253), the one in the photo collapses, but then offers me a "minus sign" to collapse an un-collapsable line (# 273). It seems to collapse the one line of whitespace after it (# 274), and that's it. But it is a closing brace. **Hypothesis:** Since I have an indented block of code (starting line # 275) beneath the property that I am defining on line # 253, I believe it is trying to alert me that I can close it. If so, and if issue is a feature not a bug, that feature is very confusing/unclear. (see Image 4) If in fact my hypothesis is correct, may I suggest using a different icon to indicate the ability to collapse indented lines beneath an object (which really does make sense, but again, is unclear in the context of collapsing the code blocks above it), since it is not technically an encapsulated code block that is being collapsed. **Image 1** **Image 2** **Image 3** **Image 4** Awesome IDE and great job folks! =)

data.title: [Extension] "write EPROTO" error while trying to download an extension through proxy

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Feb / March (didn't work before too anyway)
- OS Version: Windows (7 or 10)

I have configured my proxy settings in VSCode, and that works because I can search through extensions, and the "package.json module discovery feature" (I don't know how it's called) also works. It's just that when I click to download an extension I get a cryptic "write EPROTO" error. I tried various proxy configurations, but I didn't find anything that worked. Either I can connect or I can't, but I can never download.

Thanks for your time.

data.title: C++ syntax highlighting bug on strings containing semicolon
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional (x64)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create new file with C++ language
2. Add the following code:
   
   ```
   void fn() {
     f(";", value); // Line must begin with at least 1 space.
   }
   ```

Syntax highlighting for string begins from the second double-comma
![visual-studio-code_0 10 11_cpp-syntax-highlighting-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1532557/14410590/fff3137e-ff2a-11e5-9c9c-0e560dd3f8b1.png)

This was discovered when trying to view the muse-sequencer's [main.cpp](https://github.com/muse-sequencer/muse/blob/fbd4c3f10fa780f689c4681e4ef96ddffc216629/muse3/muse/main.cpp) (line 137).

This is an odd bug for sure because it's so easy to trigger!

data.title: Xamarin project error
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.11
- OS Version: 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a blank cross platform Xamarin project
2. Open the project folder in VSCode

I get this error in VSCode

```
[ERROR:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Error initializing task MakeDir: Could not load file or assembly 'Xamarin.iOS.Tasks.Core' or one of its dependencies
[WARNING:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Failed to process project file '/Users/pier/Projects/TestHTTP/iOS/TestHTTP.iOS.csproj'.
[ERROR] Error: Failed to start OmniSharp
```

The project builds fine in Xamarin btw.

data.title: Process crashes and graphical glitches occasionally when running on ubuntu through virtualbox
data.body: To fix this in Chrome I needed to toggle off the "Use hardware acceleration when available" checkbox in advanced settings. This maps to the Chromium pref `hardware_acceleration_mode.enabled`, aka `kHardwareAccelerationModeEnabled`.

data.title: Suddenly can't use breakpoints on TypeScript file (source map error)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Newest
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a project with the files in the following repository:
   https://github.com/Eduardogbg/vscode-issue-sample
2. Try to set a breakpoint on the .ts file

OBS: I also uploaded the task file used to create the transpiled javascript and its respective source map, because maybe the error is in the process of generating the source map, idk.

@Edit 
As reported in my repository, everything is fine with Insider's version.

data.title: copy navigate lines in files opened

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
I have many
![b2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1904029/14407950/04025376-fea4-11e5-8ba0-a29215e4dbf0.png)
 windows open:
window "1" and window "2" if I am in the "1" at the beginning, I'm reviewing the first few lines, if I open the window "2" and navigate to the end of the file, when I open the window "1" NOW it shows the final lines when I was seeing was the beginning of the file, it's annoying when you have many files and need not miss in network calls, functions, variables, etc.
- VSCode Version:0.10.11
- OS Version:win 7 64 bits, sp1
- JS files (canvas game development)
  Steps to Reproduce:
1. open two files (these have more than 500 lines) Position yourself at the beginning of the first .
2. the second fence and navigate to the last lines.
3. reopen the other and see how it is now showing the last lines.

data.title: synax check error
Get access to DOM event from tests

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am really interested in vim extensions for VS Code.
So I tried to add some integration test to some already existing extensions.

In my tests I want to set the editor text at the beginning. Then I want in a high-level way "simulate" key presses. In the end I want to assert the resulting text or behavior.

I have a hard time to "simulate" the key presses.

I was looking at the vim-mode extension for the atom text editor. In its test it has direct access to the DOM document and can therefore directly call the `dispatchEvent` method and add new `KeyboardEvent`s
https://github.com/atom/vim-mode/blob/670910880797cc545e6c62422615c8d988e44e98/spec/spec-helper.coffee#L46

Can I do the same in VS Code? 
Or are there other ways/ideas to simulate keyboard input in my tests?
